original_title: Sri Lanka rupee opens 325/330 to the US dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s rupee opened around 325/330 to the US dollar in the spot market and was quoted around 329/330 in late morning trade, dealers said.
Sri Lanka’s rupee has gained from around 360 to the US dollar after guidance peg was relaxed and appreciated to below 320 as banks and dollar holders sold down their holdings.
Further gains were capped as the centarl bank bought around 500 million US dollars.
Sri Lanka’s dollar outflows have been less than inflows for several months, amid complementary monetary policy and negative private credit.
The central bank has operated a guidance peg around 360/370 to the US dollar for several months intervenining through a surrender rule and dollar sales since mid 2022.
The surrender rule was lifte, leading ot appreciation of the currency. (Colombo/Mar14/2023)
